sub_title: Researcher | Urban Informatics | Harnessing Data for Heat Resilient Cities
summary: Giving voice to the built environment, one data-driven solution at a time! With a background in Civil and Environmental Engineering and four years of dedicated research, I'm on a mission to create urban environments that enhance people's lives. I bring a unique blend of theoretical and practical knowledge, research skills, and a global perspective honed from working on three continents. Join me as I turn data into action knowledge!

I also led the process of procuring the funding to bring international scholars to the university.', 'title': 'Lecturer', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 163191, 'name': 'Concordia University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/D4E0BAQHwJM6UBUaPiw/company-logo_400_400/0/1665001010071?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=ul77-gKwFMJSy6H_XcK34hSWN27rXnCIUP8iIor6hPk', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/concordia-university/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Montreal, Canada Area', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}, 'end': {'month': 5, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'company': 'Concordia University', 'description': "During my visit to Concordia, we analyzed Montreal's urban geometry based on LiDAR data of the city from 2015, available on the Montreal open data portal.", 'title': 'Mitacs Globalink Research Intern', 'employment_type': 'Internship'}]}, {'company': {'id': 9246, 'name': 'KAIST', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C560BAQEdtRJuNmZg7w/company-logo_400_400/0/1519855932164?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=zpSxMuWTJrepepcxvNUmy02b3pi2BwdozekPioUrVd8', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/kaist/', 'employees': {'start': 5001, 'end': 10000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Yuseong-gu, Daejeon, Korea', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2014}}, 'company': 'KAIST', 'description': 'The main goal of my work here was to study the feasibility of designing and building a set of technical solutions to solve urban and climatic challenges by best utilizing natural resources.

To do so, designed a scientific methodology to customize policies to enhance green buildings in urban areas with different social and environmental characteristics.

Developed a cluster analysis in R (Statistical Computing) to classify 214 countries according to their social and environmental characteristics.

Prepared reports to document the performance of green builds based on LEED, Energy Star and BREEAM scoring systems.', 'title': 'Graduate Research Assistant', 'employment_type': None}, {'location': 'Yuseong-gu, Daejeon, Korea', 'date': {'start': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2009}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'company': 'KAIST', 'description': 'My main activities were divided in three big components. 

In the first one, I analyzed  the design and environmental impact of Tidal Dams. By using Axiomatic Design Theory, Human Center Design and Fuzzy Methodology, this study resulted in two published international conference papers.

In the second big component of my work at IDEA Lab, I served as Head Teaching Assistant for the Freshman Design Class. As head TA, I was responsible for providing support to the faculty members and the students enrolled in the class. 

During the class students went through all of the basic steps of the conceptual design process while learning about formal design theories such as Axiomatic Design and TRIZ. At the end of the semester, the projects designed by the students were presented in a week-long poster fair that was open to the public.

The last big component of my work here was planning and supporting three international conferences in South Korea. Where researchers and scientists from all over the world got together to share their knowledge and ideas about design methodologies, design manufacturing and design thinking.', 'title': 'Undergraduate Research Assistant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'CT&S Corporation', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Colombia', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'company': 'CT&S Corporation', 'description': 'CT&S Corporation was an initiative of a group of talent engineers looking to provide IT solutions to the Administrative Department of Science, Technology and Innovation of Colombia. CT&S primarily focused on software development and deployment. 

I co-coordinated several research projects aimed at collecting, processing and analyzing the research production data. I also negotiated contracts for 105.000 EUR with various clients, drafted cooperation agreements, planned and executed budgets and participated in the development of the algorithm for the ranking of research groups in Colombia.', 'title': 'Co-founder', 'employment_type': None}]}]
